Gift to Kim Jong Il 
    Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a gift from the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies.
 It was conveyed to an official concerned by Juan Manuel Suarez del Toro, president of the International Federation, on a visit to Korea.

articles.content:
Moves of S. Korean Anti-Reunification Forces Accused 
    Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the National Alliance of Youth and Students for the Country's Reunification issued a commentary on October 20 to denounce the south Korean Grand National Party, the anti-reunification forces, for setting prosecution in motion to take issue with the academic activity of Prof. Kang Jong Gu to punish him and scheming to bring about political chaos.
 The present situation urgently requires to remove such anti-reunification forces as the GNP and repeal the "National Security Law" standing in the way of reunification, the commentary said.    
 It appealed to the south Korean youth and students to turn out in the struggle to liquidate the anti-reunification forces opposed to the June 15 era of independent reunification and to open up a road of reunification.

U.S. Moves for War of Aggression Flailed in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Members of civic and public organizations of south Korea including the Reunification Solidarity, the People's Solidarity, the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification and the All-People Measure Committee for Checking the Expansion of the U.S. Military Base in Phyongthaek reportedly held a rally in front of the building of the south Korean Ministry of National Defense on Oct. 21 to denounce warmongers for plotting a war of aggression. 
 They charged that at the 37th meeting of the security consultative council the United States forced the south Korean authorities to come out in materializing the strategic flexibility of the U.S. troops stationed in south Korea, pretending to hand over its right of wartime operation.
 After the rally they marched up to the U.S. military base in Ryongsan and held a meeting to urge the repeal of the plan for a war in the Korean Peninsula, implementation of a joint statement agreed at the six-way talks and withdrawal of the U.S. troops from south Korea.    
 Ri Kyu Jae, chairman of the South Headquarters of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification, and other speakers said that the security consultative council meeting betrayed the U.S. intention to keep its troops in this land at any cost and that they would wage a struggle to get the U.S. troops withdrawn by the concerted efforts of the Korean nation.

articles.title: Anti-Bird Flu Work Intensified in DPRK
Brilliant Feats Everlasting with Korea-China Friendship
articles.content:
Anti-Bird Flu Work Intensified in DPRK
    Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- A nation-wide campaign to prevent bird flu epidemic has been intensified in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea under the unified guidance of the State Emergency Anti-epidemic Committee as it has spread to different parts of the world.
 The Ministry of Agriculture, Ministry of Public Health, State Bureau for Quality Control, Pyongyang City Poultry Guidance Bureau and other related units are enhancing their role in this campaign.
 In an interview with KCNA, Vice-Minister of Agriculture Mun Ung Jo said that as the bird influenza has rapidly spread to different parts of the world with the south-east Asian region as the center, the government has taken necessary steps to prevent the bird flu virus from affecting the country.
 The government, based on the experience gained in the anti-bird flu epidemic work, has established a system of quickly and correctly reporting an outbreak of the case to the central guidance office while making all material and technical preparations so as to remove any slight symptoms in time.
 Information activities are also brisk to prevent bird influenza. Materials related to the outbreak of the case and its damage in foreign countries and materials on technology needed for preventing it have been sent to the provinces, cities and counties.    
 Such anti-epidemic measures as medical check-up of the workers, thorough sterilization and quarantine at poultry farms have also been taken.
 In particular, the movement of migrants is under regular observation, their excretion being examined and families and special farms are required to breed poultry in pens.    
 Various kinds of poultry and their products imported from abroad and travelers are thoroughly quarantined at ports and frontier stations.
 Meanwhile, scientific researches into separating and identifying bird flu viruses are being made on the basis of successfully making vaccine against the bird flu virus which was found in the country

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets President of IFRCRCS
First Pyongyang Autumn International Commodity Exhibition Opens
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets President of IFRCRCS
    Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a conversation with Juan Manuel Suarez del Toro, president of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies, and his party at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday.
 On hand were Jang Jae On, chairman of the Central Committee of the DPRK Red Cross Society, and others and the head of the aid delegation of the IFRCRCS.
